Node.definition: = process by which a fire starts burning; ≈ used as a metaphor for anger

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= a dense growth of twigs, branches, shrubs and other plants, especially found under trees
= process by which fire causes a liquid to reach the temperature at which it bubbles and turns to vapour

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to tremble|to shake|to quake|to be disturbed|to be perturbed|to be excited|to flutter
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans, deities, places and activities have qualities that inspire fear in others

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= process by which an object is shaking with force, ◄ as if trembling with fear
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= marker indicating that an object or event is not included in a range of objects or events

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to defer action|to wait|to lie in wait|to delay|to hesitate|to long
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state
= action by which humans go and meet other humans ► with the purpose of killing or harming that person

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= state in which humans have been morally and/or ethically contaminated by evil behavior
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= piece of cloth worn by a woman during her menstrual period; ≈ associated with uncleanness

= action of humans or deities that is in accordance with the requirements of the divine law and and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this type of behavior as a standard, which often requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

= one of the expanded, usually green structures growing from the stem of a plant; ► providing shade; ≈ associated with life when green, but known to wither when disconnected from the plant and therefore also denoting the fragility of life
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: to call on (someone's) name; hence: = action by which humans acknowledge a deity and are willing to live in accordance with some of the requirements of that deity
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= action by which humans actively engage in serving a deity

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them
literally: to cause to melt; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to be strongly affected by fear
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a person, ◄ compared to a father, ► who provides care for the people under his authority; ≈ often extended to refer to God
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= state in which an event takes place with a strong intensity
= an adverb that specifies unending time

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
literally: to look at; hence: = action by which humans or deities pay attention to certain matters

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= indirect male progenitor

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value
= state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= to restrain oneself from showing emotions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= state in which an event takes place with a strong intensity
